intro: Cabreraea andina, commonly known as the Andean cabreraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine by local communities for its purported healing properties.
